brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators performed a 12-week, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled
      crossover human trial to evaluate the efficacy and safety of chungkookjang on improvement of
      metabolic syndrome. The investigators measured decrement of body fat parameters, including
      Body Fat Mass, Percent Body Fat, Fat Free Mass, Weight and BMI(body mass index), and
      monitored their blood pressure.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Chungkookjang on Improvement of Metabolic Syndrome

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Males and females 18-29 years old

          -  BMI(body mass index) ≥ 23 kg/m2 or WC(Waist Circumference) ≥ 90(men), WC(Waist
             Circumference) ≥ 85(women)

          -  Able to give informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Allergic or hypersensitive to any of the ingredients in the test products

          -  The diagnosis of type 1 and type 2 diabetes or fasting glucose ≥ 126mg/dL

          -  Systolic pressure ≥ 160mmHg, diastolic pressure ≥ 100mmHg

          -  History of reaction to any of the test products or of gastrointestinal diseases such
             as Crohn's disease or gastrointestinal surgery

          -  History of alcohol or substance abuse

          -  Participation in any other clinical trials within past 2 months

          -  Laboratory test, medical or psychological conditions deemed by the investigators to
             interfere with successful participation in the study

facility.name: Obesity Research Center of Chonbuk National University

primary_outcome.description: Body Fat Mass was measured in study visit 1(0 week) and visit 3(12 week).
Percent Body Fat was measured in study visit 1(0 week) and visit 3(12 week).

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Obesity Research Center of Chonbuk National University

secondary_outcome.description: Glucose was measured in study visit 1(0 week) and visit 3(12 week).
Cholesterol was measured in study visit 1(0 week) and visit 3(12 week).

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Prevention
